comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.comss.ru/list.php?c=club](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.comss.ru%2Flist.php%3Fc%3Dclub) ### Comment > Рекламный блок находится почти в самом конце страницы (и других подобных следующих страниц (1,2,3,4,5 и т.д.) в этом разделе), до этого места с рекламным блоком стриницу нужно сначала немало прокрутить. This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension, Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

4.2.241

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

See comments

### Ad Blocking

EasyList

### Privacy

EasyPrivacy, Fanboy's Enhanced Tracking List

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

AdGuard Dutch filter, EasyList Dutch

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

The normal EasyList Dutch filter list is outdated a lot and in the past they wouldn't approve my new rules as it didn't meet their syntax. But that really hindered me, as some rules need the advanced Adguard/uBlock syntax. 

Below is a list of domains, so you can verify my rules. I have tested them recently (today and max 1 week old):

comment.body:
It seems that it's caused by `Legitimate URL Shortener` filter list, so as a temporary solution, please add this rule:
```adblock
@@||cravesandflames.com/safe.php?link=*&referrer=$removeparam=referrer
```
to user rules.

<hr>

@DandelionSprout Could you please take a look?
To reproduce that issue, go to - [https://jnovels.com/tearmoon-empire-volume-11-epub/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fjnovels.com%2Ftearmoon-empire-volume-11-epub%2F) and click on the `VOLUME 11` link (marked on the screenshot below).

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/29142494/58be7626-8a71-4612-9c7b-a2e9fed4d1d0)

</details>

It's caused by this rule:
```adblock
$document,removeparam=referrer,domain=~bolt.com|~f4map.com|~deviantart.com|~github.com|~discover.*|~vimeo.*|~123-reg.co.uk
```

issue.title: www.comss.ru
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://www.comss.ru/list.php?c=club](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.comss.ru%2Flist.php%3Fc%3Dclub) ### Comment > Рекламный блок находится почти в самом конце страницы (и других подобных следующих страниц (1,2,3,4,5 и т.д.) в этом разделе), до этого места с рекламным блоком стриницу нужно сначала немало прокрутить. Понимаю что это сайт-партнер AdGuard и сам люблю и AdGuard и этот хороший сайт, но это не значит же что там можно\нужно не блокировать явную рекламу. Но в случае отклонения этого моего запроса прошу хотя бы тогда прокомментировать. Заранее спасибо. Username: `@NUser2018` ### [NSFW] Screenshots

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://raw.githubusercontent.com/DandelionSprout/adfilt/master/Alternate%20versions%20Anti-Malware%20List/AntiMalwareAdGuard.txt](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fraw.githubusercontent.com%2FDandelionSprout%2Fadfilt%2Fmaster%2FAlternate%2520versions%2520Anti-Malware%2520List%2FAntiMalwareAdGuard.txt) ### Comment > adguard extension fails to retrieve the list data. Once it is added to custom filters, clicking on "update lists" does not update this list. The list needs to be deleted and re-added manually in order to work. Not sure what causes this, the other custom filters I added work as intended. This does not happen on the android version, the current version (29December2023v2 as you can see in the screenshot I took) is correctly downloaded. The browser extension straight up ignores new updates (version showed in the custom filters section doesn't increase), not sure if windows app is affected. ### [NSFW] Screenshots

issue.title: "AdGuard Tracking Protection" list breaks caching in uBlock Origin
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

2.0.65.39

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

all URLs

### Ad Blocking

EasyList

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

This issue occurs in uBlock Origin, but it is quite major. Therefore I am creating an issue here aswell.  
For reference: [uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/21841](https://github.com/uBlockOrigin/uAssets/issues/21841)

Enabling the list "AdGuard Tracking Protection" disables caching for all websites, reloading them on every visit, including navigating through tab history.

I could not reproduce this behavior in the adguard extension for firefox, however I have never used it before so I may not have configured it correctly.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
> This is basically an alias to [$redirect](https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/create-own-filters/#redirect-modifier) since it has the same "redirection" values and the logic is almost similar. The difference is that $redirect-rule is applied only in the case when the target request is blocked by a different basic rule.

https://adguard.com/kb/general/ad-filtering/create-own-filters/#redirect-rule-modifier

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [http://www.googleapis.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.googleapis.com) ### Comment > Hi, > > My phone was hacked by someone just now. I was unable to do anything on my phone. Everything started to freeze up. But I noticed that the network data was still going back and forward and maintained connection even after I turn off the Data Connection. > > It was going on for about 30 to 40 minutes. The were files being transferred. There were modification made to the system files. There were lotsa new files appeared and the movements of flipping the pages in my phone seemed to be not as smooth as always. > > I have Adguard installed. I could see there were a lot of scripts with weird Domain names. I'm not sure what to call of such a things happening to my phone. All I could say is thats not normal. > > Would u help me on this matter? I do think my phone currently is being controlled by someone, other than me. > > What sort of advice n service that u might be able to offer me?
